channel.title: Ubuntu adopting proprietary software
channel.description:
Proprietary Software and Linux: Good, Bad or Somewhere in Between? Canonical is looking into selling proprietary software like Adobe’s Photoshop and Apple’s iTunes within its distribution, Ubuntu. This would undoubtedly be helpful for certain end users wanting to switch to Linux, but is it good for free software in the long run?
Full article: http://www.linux-mag.com/cache/7677/1.html Thoughts? I think this is a great step in the right direction

item.title: Ubuntu adopting proprietary software
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

runescape3dude:

I must have been out of the scene for ages cause last time I recall iTunes was free.

Free as in beer, not as in speech.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu adopting proprietary software

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I guess it will be good, as long as they don’t take away the free alternatives like GIMP (which I don’t believe they would ever do).

item.title: Ubuntu adopting proprietary software
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:2, topic:326566”]As I said on irc, This is a good thing but it will probably just be the windows build optimised for wine so it’s nothing big. That probably only requires a bit of modification.

inb4 people start illegally torrenting linux software.[/quote]
theres lots of software for linux that isnt free. for example vmware workstation, i torrented that years ago for linux

Read full topic
